meanings.definition: The act of establishing or organizing something as an institution.
meanings.sent1: The institutionalization of the new school was a lengthy process involving many meetings and paperwork.
meanings.sent2: The institutionalization of the government agency brought about more structure and accountability.
meanings.sent3: After the institutionalization of the pet adoption center, even the cats seemed to follow the rules.
meanings.sent4: The institutionalization of the company's policies was like building a strong foundation for future growth.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalization of the rules made it easier for everyone to know what was expected.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting an individual to life in an institution, especially a mental health facility.
meanings.sent1: The institutionalization of the new patient was done with care and patience by the staff.
meanings.sent2: The institutionalization of the elderly residents in the nursing home required understanding and support.
meanings.sent3: The institutionalization of the young boy into the boarding school felt like a big adventure to him.
meanings.sent4: The institutionalization of the troubled teen was like guiding them towards a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalization of the artist into the creative community was a smooth transition.

meanings.definition: The process of making something a standard or norm within a society or organization.
meanings.sent1: The institutionalization of recycling in the office helped reduce waste and promote sustainability.
meanings.sent2: The institutionalization of remote work policies became essential during the pandemic.
meanings.sent3: The institutionalization of casual Fridays at work brought a sense of relaxation to the office environment.
meanings.sent4: The institutionalization of healthy eating habits in schools aimed to improve students' well-being.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalization of safety protocols in the lab ensured a secure working environment for all.
